content.description:
This route includes 6 bolts to a chain anchor. The crux is definitely at the fourth bolt, as you pass from the "joint" of the bottom rock onto the slab of the upper rock. This crux is very well protected by the fourth bolt. After the crux, you will traverse to the left across a slabby section with good feet and hands, clipping 2 more bolts. Rap from the fixed anchor.

This route is identified as the tallest formation on the right as you enter The Courtyard area.

Note: I would not recommend cleaning this route on rappel. The rappel will take you straight down (approximately 30 feet) to a lower rock. Walk to your right on this rock, and then continue the rappel down the chimney crack to the start of the climb.
content.location: North side of The Courtyard. Morning shade.

content.description:
Climb the face/arete using small edges and the arete itself to about the midway point then move right to join

Pulp Friction

at it's 5th bolt and finish on that route.
content.location:
Up and left from

Pulp Friction

starting from the arete.

content.description:
Despite the catchy name there's no friction moves to be had on this climb which is instead all about thin edges.

Start up out of a pit on easy plates to gain the first bolt below a prominent bush and then diagonal your way up and left across the dark face to anchors. The crux is a thin section getting to the 5th bolt but the finishing moves can be tough if pumped and the holds not chalked.
content.location:
Down and left from

Disconnect

on the west face a two-tone pillar of rock.

content.description: Start up a thin slab to reach a crux bulge which is bypassed using a committing sequence and then romp up a plated slab to anchors atop the formation.
content.location:
Left side of the west face of a block behind and left of the formation with

Sliver of Light

.

content.description:
Climb up a thin mottled slab via thin edges to gain twin knobs then punch it over the bulge on thin crimps to finish up the very easy plated slab to anchors.

This route has been rated 5.10a in various guidebooks but is much harder than that taking the obvious line up the face. Evidence of broken rock at the bulge as well as the initial slab suggest that perhaps the holds that made it easier now lie at the base.

A 5.10a (ish) way can be found by stemming off a boulder at the base to start and then climbing the right margin of the formation to bypass the crux bulge. This variation is not recommended due to the potential swing should one fall off.
content.location:
Starts about 8 feet right of

Disconnect

on a thin mottled slab.

content.description:
Climb up along the left side of the narrow face and get established on a series of flakes clipping the first two bolts. The crux comes moving to the third bolt as you reach for a horizontal and join the right arete. Continue up past one more bolt to anchors.

This thing is very short and had it a good landing might make a fun highball boulder problem.
content.location:
North side of the block with

Sliver of Light

. Circle around past the base of Disconnect, via some scrambling, to reach the base.
